intro: Stylidium angustifolium subsp. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fleshy leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of yellow or orange, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. This species is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
